messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Invite to Intentional Community List
messages.msgSnippet: Brenda, we may be kindred spirits, but Texas has no homeschool laws, so I don t think I ll ever be leaving it.  I m interested in starting an intentional
messages.messageBody:
Brenda, we may be kindred spirits, but Texas has no homeschool laws, so I don't think I'll ever be leaving it. I'm interested in starting an intentional community, or even better.... a commune. I have two other interested families, but I doubt anything will happen soon. Our focus is unschooling, but in the mean time, I'm trying my best to move onto a street that has 6 other homeschooling families, 2 or whom are unschoolers... with me, that would be 3 unschooling families... getting close to an even split.

:o)

Come to Texas!

:o)
Nichole
Unschooling mama to Margaux, 7
----- Original Message -----
From: Brenda in Louisa
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, June 27, 2004 6:55 PM
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] Invite to Intentional Community List


Hi,

I'm Brenda, an unschooler of my two children, 11 & 12. I may not
have time to participate in this group, but I wanted to invite anyone
interested to join my e-mail list to discuss options of intentional
community for homeschooling families.

I'm exploring the possibilities of starting a family-focused
community near Twin Oaks Community in Virginia (I've been a member
there for 16 years), but the e-mail list is also for homeschool
families interested in intentional community in other areas.

I am not writing this with the intention of starting a discussion on
this list. Please e-mail me or subscribe to the list at:

ICfam-subscribe@yahoogroups.com

Brenda


Yahoo! Groups Sponsor
ADVERTISEMENT





------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Yahoo! Groups Links

a.. To visit your group on the web, go to:
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/unschoolingbasics/

b.. To unsubscribe from this group, send an email to:
unschoolingbasics-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com

c.. Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to the Yahoo! Terms of Service.



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
